inlineContent.text: does the work of laying out predefined tiles in a grid of any size. Typically, you configure 9-slice images (tile groups) in Xcodeâ€™s SpriteKit scene editor and paint the look of your tile map ahead of time versus configuring the tile map in code.

As with sprite nodes, you can layer tile maps with different blend modes or control it with actions and physics, for example, for the purpose of parallax scrolling. The rendered tile map can be post processed with an
to add effects such as motion blur or atmospheric perspective.
A tile map can only render tile definitions that exist within the
A tile map does not expose its tiles as nodes, and therefore you cannot assign individual tiles with a different
. Instead, layer tile map nodes on top of each other at the varying zPositions, and layer invisible
on top of the tile map node to attach physicsBodies to your tile map node.
To work with a tile map programmatically, you supply
with a tile set that defines the tile definitions it can render. Then, fill each tile in the tile map with the
method and set individual tiles with

abstract.text: Add high-performance 2D content with smooth animations to your app, or create a game with a high-level set of 2D game-based tools.
The base class of all SpriteKit nodes.
The physics body associated with the node.
The position of the node in its parentâ€™s coordinate system.
The height of the node relative to its parent.
An object that allows you to apply a custom fragment shader.

Rules that describe how various tiles should be placed in a map.
A two-dimensional array of images.

The values of each attribute associated with the nodeâ€™s attached shader.
Defines the blend mode to use when compositing the tile map over other nodes.
The base color for the tile map. The influence of the color over the tile map nodeâ€™s textures is controlled by
Controls the blending between the texture and the tile map objectâ€™s
. Values are clamped between zero and one where zero has no color blending and one has the maximum color blending.
When creating a tile map node programmatically, this function performs a fill operation with the specified tile group.
A mask that defines how the tile map is lit by light nodes in the scene.
The overall size of the tile map.

Sets an attribute value for an attached shader.
Defines a shader which is applied to each tile of the tile map.

The tile set being used by this tile map. The tile map object can only display tiles that exist in this set.

The value of a shader attribute.
A container for related tile groups.
